column4: um, is dualbooting with dual hard drives any different than with partitioning?
it's not a 404, its a bit slow though: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RecoveringUbuntuAfterInstallingWindows
because then I'd have to deal with exiting out of a root shell
why not just use su, in that case?
in that case, can I at least get it to stop playing DVDs automatically?
ok, so if I were to deinstall evolution?

that'd be fine.  You'll be forced to remove ubuntu-desktop (the meta package) but you'll still be fine.  You'll need to reinstall ubuntu-desktop (and therefore evolution) to upgrade to edgy and beyond and stuff though
so, I need it for dist-upgrade?
you'll need the meta packages, yes.
apt-cache show [package]  or apt-cache showpkg [package]  depending on what info you want
